definition: name of an ancient barbarian country, possibly Taiwan
non-Han people, esp. to the East of China/barbarians/to wipe out/to exterminate/to tear down/to raze
former southernmost province of the Chinese Empire, now northern Vietnam
Ryūkyū/refers to the Ryūkyū Islands 琉球群島|琉球群岛[Liu2 qiu2 Qun2 dao3] stretching from Japan to Taiwan/Liuchiu township in Pingtung County 屏東縣|屏东县[Ping2 dong1 Xian4], Taiwan
Korean Goryeo dynasty, 918-1392/Korea, esp. in context of art and culture
Champa (Sanskrit: Campapura or Campanagara), ancient kingdom in the South of Vietnam c. 200-1693
Funan, ancient state in Southeast Asia (1st - 6th century)
Khmer kingdom of Kampuchea or Cambodia/Chinese term for Cambodia from 7th to 15th century
Qiongzhou, historic name for Hainan Island 海南島|海南岛[Hai3 nan2 Dao3]
seat of the principal county magistrate in imperial China
Tsushima Island, between Japan and South Korea
Paekche or Baekje (18 BC-660 AD), one of the Korean Three Kingdoms
Shule, oasis state in central Asia (near modern Kashgar) at different historical periods
Luzon, island of the Philippines/the Ryukyu islands
Baiyue, generic term for southern ethnic groups
